pullrequest.title: Add a new semi-supervised test case

content.raw: The dummy data was selected for simplicity and being able to produce results that could be manually inspected for "good enough" results. There should be a way of noticing if the supervision if at all has an effect. This testcase, for example, may not catch the case where if a new bug was introduced and `--semisupervised` was somehow disabled. Admittedly that's probably not the case currently (the supervision probably has some influence over the final results) but the testcase itself is not convincing of that.
content.html: The dummy data was selected for simplicity and being able to produce results that could be manually inspected for "good enough" results. There should be a way of noticing if the supervision if at all has an effect. This testcase, for example, may not catch the case where if a new bug was introduced and --semisupervised was somehow disabled. Admittedly that's probably not the case currently (the supervision probably has some influence over the final results) but the testcase itself is not convincing of that.
